rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Integer rating (from 0 to 4) given to journal artice for enhanced content.
Integer rating (from 0 to 4) given to journal artice for peer review.
Comment on overall Five Stars rating given to journal artice.

rdf:Description.dc:description:
The Five Stars of Online Research Articles Ontology, is an ontology written in OWL 2 DL to enable characterization of the five attributes of an online journal article - peer review, open access, enriched content, available datasets and machine-readable metadata - using the criteria discussed in the paper by David Shotton entitled The Five Stars of Online Journal Articles â€” a Framework for Article Evaluation, published in D-Lib Magazine 18 (1/2) (January/February 2012 issue). doi: https://doi.org/10.1045/january2012-shotton.
The ontology is simple, consisting only of those data properties required to permit a rating for each of the five stars, and for the paper as a whole, to be recorded as an integer, together with an associated comment. It is intended for use by publishers and others wishing to encode Five Stars ratings for individual papers in machine-readable form.
Other ontologies, for example DCMI Metadata Terms (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) and FaBiO, the FRBR-aligned Bibliographic Ontology (http://purl.org/spar/fabio), may be used to describe other aspects of a journal article, e.g. authors, journal name, and publication year.
rdf:Description.dc:creator: David Shotton
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
The Five Stars of Online Research Articles Ontology (FiveStars) is an ontology written in OWL 2 DL to enable characterization of the five attributes of an online journal article - peer review, open access, enriched content, available datasets and machine-readable metadata.
**URL:** http://purl.org/spar/fivestars
**Creators**: [David Shotton](http://orcid.org/0000-0001-5506-523X)
**License:** [Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode)
**Website:** http://www.sparontologies.net/ontologies/fivestars
**Cite as:** Shotton, D. (2012). The Five Stars of Online Journal Articles - a Framework for Article Evaluation. In D-Lib Magazine, 18 (1/2). DOI: https://doi.org/10.1045/january2012-shotton
rdf:Description.dc:rights: This work is distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).
rdf:Description.dc:title: The Five Stars of Online Research Articles Ontology (FiveStars)

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Comment explaining Five Stars ratings given to journal artice relating to available datasets.
Integer rating (from 0 to 4) given to journal artice for machine-readable metadata.
Comment explaining Five Stars ratings given to journal artice relating to open access.
Integer rating (from 0 to 4) given to journal artice for available datasets.
Overall Five stars rating (on integer scale from from 0 to 20) given to journal artice, obtained by summing the individual ratings given for each of the Five Stars of Online Journal Articles.
Integer rating (from 0 to 4) given to journal artice for open access.
Comment explaining Five Stars ratings given to journal artice relating to enhanced content.
Comment explaining Five Stars ratings given to journal artice relating to machine-readable metadata.
Comment explaining Five Stars ratings given to journal artice relating to peer review.
